Manager Response: Hi Coley,   First thank you so much for your recent stay with us.  We definitely appreciate you and your friends staying with us and we would love the opportunity to wow you.  I am sorry that you were not able to completely enjoy your stay with us because of the various issues.  Here at the hotel we strive to make sure that we provide a great experience through friendly and effective guest service, cleanliness and a place where you can relax.  I am pleased to see that housekeeping was able to provide a great service in cleaning your room and that you liked our renovated rooms. I do appreciate your feedback and am looking into the other items that you have mentioned.  We are always looking to improve so again thank you for taking the time to share your experience and we will wow you next time!

Summary: I've always wondered who those reviewers were who hated a place, especially when others were positive. Well, now I know. I've always thought the Marriott name assured clean, comfortable rooms with good service. But now, I'm not so sure. First, the place has balconies, which always seems pretty low-rent in this day and age. That should have tipped us off. It was like 105 the afternoon we checked in and I was really looking forward to relaxing in our room before heading out for dinner in Newport Beach. Well, when we stepped into the room it was stifling. Not only that, it smelled like the room hadn't been aired out in months. Finally, my husband went in the bathroom and said, There are bugs in here." I immediately went to call the front desk and...there were bugs crawling on the
Manager Response: Hello Elizabeth,   Thank you not only for your recent stay but also sharing your experience.  I apologize that you were not able to fully enjoy your stay.  Like many hotels we do not have windows that open but our rooms are aired out.  Southern California weather provides beautiful days but can also bring with it some not so comfortable temperatures but we will gladly assist anyone with the air conditioner for a more enjoyable stay.  We are far from a roach motel and work very hard to ensure that each room is comfortable for our guests.  We are proud to be a part of the Marriott family and like many within that family are a franchised hotel that strictly adheres to brand standards.  We will definitely look into the issues that were presented as we welcome feedback as it is an opportunity to improve and do hope that your next trip tp the area we have an opportunity to wow you with our friendly service and clean comfortable rooms.

Summary Heading: Comfortable room with very good amenities
Summary: I stayed in this hotel for a period of 2~3 weeks. The location is too close to CA-91 as well 15 minutes drive to John Wayne airport. Plenty of close parking spots, super clean rooms that have been recently renovated, quiet pool, good breakfast, and very helpful staff.
Manager Response: Hi Bassel,   Thank you so much for making us your home away from home while you had your extended stay with us.  It is wonderful to see that you enjoyed our renovated rooms and that we were able to meet your expectations of your stay.  Especially glad to se eyou enjoyed our breakfast and found our staff helpful.  We do hope that the next time you are in the area you will stay with us again.    Warm wishes! Nicole

Summary: Pleasantly surprised how nice the room layout and bathroom setup is.  In town for a wedding and this was good location.  Breakfast has plenty of options for all and even had items available after 10am which was great as I arrived late on day one.  Everything seemed very clean and the staff was all very friendly and helpful. Would have been 5 stars, but our AC was noisy when it did work and unfortunately did not work the first day.  It was working after day one.  Others in my group had no problem with their AC.
Manager Response: Hi Stephen,  Thank you for your recent stay with us and foro providing your feedback.  I am pleased to see you were able to enjoy your stay with especially breakfast.  It has been extremely hot so I am glad we were able to fix your air conditioning unit to make it a more relaxing stay.   We appreciate having you as our guest and hopefully we will see you the next time you are in Anaheim.   Thank you!

Summary: this hotel is absolutely wonderful. the rooms were fresh, so clean and the bed was a piece of heaven. it was incredibly comfortable. bathroom was beautiful and clean. my room was quiet, peaceful and comfortable. free parking, free wifi, free crib. what more can i ask for? i used my marriott associate rate. and my family and i needed a hotel due to renovations. so it was perfect location near my home. this hotel will be known as my home away from home. breakfast was okay. i loved the cranberry juice and bagel i had. kind of cold in the morning.. dont know why the A/C was on.. the staff could have been a bit more friendly. they were short with guests.. the lobby was beautful and kept clean. overall, its a cozy, clean, and awsome hotel. it was just renovated so the rooms are
Manager Response: Hi Annissa,  It is so great to see that you enjoyed all that our newly renovated hotel has to offer from the rooms, the lobby, the complimentary breakfast and complimentary parking.  We do strive for awesome customer service and I apologize you found our breakfast service a bit chilly.  We definitely appreciate having another Marriott family member stay with us and look forward to having you again.    Thank you for your feedback and we look forward to seeing you soon!

Summary: Total renovation, big improvement.  Front desk personnel very knowledgeable and helpful.  Breakfast improved from years ago.Rooms were attractive and clean, lobby was comfortable.  Ample self parking and close to restaurants and other shopping.
Manager Response: Hello RuFrank:  It is so great to hear that a past guest has come back and can tell the difference after our renovation!  I am pleased that you enjoyed our more modern rooms and lobby.  We take pride in providing guests an awesome breakfast and it sounds like you enjoyed the waffles, scrambled eggs and sausage that we now provide.  We hope to wow you again the next time you stay.  Thank you again and hope to see you soon!

Summary Heading: Pretty Out of the Way,but Inexpensive
Summary: This hotel is on the older end of the Fairfield Inn's I have stayed at -- every room opens onto a common balcony which would not have been too bad except I had guys outside smoking until all hours of the morning -- the rooms were clean but it was not an enjoyable stay.
Manager Response: Hello Mike D,   Thank you for taking the time to share your experience here at the Fairfield Inn Anaheim Hills.  Although I am pleased to see that you had a nice rate that does not make up for the less than stellar stay.  We do have designated smoking areas such as the patio and it sounds as if there were guests that did not adhere to that room.  I do so hope that the next time you are in the area you will stay with us again so that we can wow you with our service and a good nights rest.   Thank you again we do appreciate your stay and for sharing.

Summary: This hotel is just what you would expect for a motel-type Marriott property:   Clean comfortable rooms, but nothing spectacular.  A bit over-priced for what you get, I thought.  The outside of the buildings are typical multi-story road-side motel, but cleaner.  My room faced the pool, which was noisy with screaming kids at 10 at night, but quieted down later in the evening.  Location of the motel off the freeway is good.  Staff was friendly and efficient.  Breakfast bar was just fair, but a struggle to find with no signage and located in a separate building.   The entry to the breakfast bar was littered with empty boxes, and walking up to it, you got the feeling you were going into the hotel laundry or some other service area.  Over-all, a fair property, but a bit disappointing
Manager Response: Thank you so much for providing your feedback.  I am glad to see that we met your expectations of for our guest rooms as well as our friendly and efficient service.  I am sorry that there was difficulty in locating our breakfast room and am seeing into your suggestion for signage.  We do want everyone to enjoy our waffles, sausage and eggs for breakfast.  It is our hope that the next time you are in town you might stay with us again so that not only can we meet your expectations but we can exceed them so that you have an outstanding stay.    Thank you,  Nicole Reid Sales Manager

Summary Heading: Great first stay in the US
Summary: Stayed at the Fairfield in for a one week business trip and was very impressed. The staff are extremely friendly and helpful, the rooms spotlessly clean and the bed very, very comfortable. My room was located on the side closest to the Freeway so I was a little concerned about noise but to be honest I barely even noticed. Air con and wi-fi worked perfectly too. On top of all this, the location is great.  There are some nice restaurants and cafes within 2 min walk and it is easy to get to places like Newport Beach, an Angels game and a great shopping Mall (Outlets at Orange) and of course Disney is close by. This was my first visit to the US and if I ever return to the area I wouldn’t hesitate to book the Fairfield Inn, Anaheim Hills.
Manager Response: May I just say that it sounds as if you had a great first trip to the US and I am so glad that we were able to be apart of that!  Thank you for staying with us and sharing your experience with others.  Hopefully your second trip to the US brings you back to the Anaheim area and we are able to see you once again.   Thank you! Nicole Reid Sales Manager

Summary Heading: Nice place close to Anaheim attractions
Summary: We were in town for an Angel's game and a wedding in Laguna Beach.  This hotel is conveniently located off the 91 Freeway.  It's close enough to Disneyland and Anaheim Stadium to be conveniently without being right in the middle of everything.  It's a nice hotel that serves a pretty good, hot breakfast buffet.  The room was a little small but everything else was fine.
Manager Response: Hi TravelingGal it is so nice to see that you enjoyed your recent stay with us while you were out here to enjoy an Angels game.  Thank you for sharing your experience with us as we very much enjoy feedback.  The next time you are in the area please come visit us again!

Summary: Very clean with modern, comfortable rooms. The location is great...near restaurants, a grocery store, and located right off the 91 freeway. The desk clerk who checked us in was extremely friendly and pleasant . The only flaw I found is this is an outside-entrance hotel, which i don't care for. Having said that, it didn't feel "motel-ish"(as most of these style tend to), especially once was inside my room.  Considering the full assortment of $100/night price range hotels, this is as good as I've seen. I would have given it 5 stars had it been a corridor-entrance hotel, like how Courtyard by Marriott hotels are.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your kind words and for sharing your experience with us.  I am pleased to see that you enjoyed the rooms, the staff and the location and hope the next time you are in the area you stay with us again.   Thank you again!

Summary: Because this Fairfield has exterior corridors, it has a sort of updated motor lodge feel.  My room faced the pool, away from the freeway, and I heard no highway noise in my room.  The wifi was okay, but kicked me off the network a couple of times.  No problems with cleanliness, and the rooms appear to have been recently renovated.  The staff was consistently professional.  It was very good for the price I paid (around $90).
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your stay with us in April!  I do apologize for the internet as we have been in the process of upgrading our service.  Soon we will have high speed internet of 20MBPS.  I hope that you stay with us again soon.

Summary: Friendly staff, great location, clean, comfortable and spacious room with full amenities. Large, well-provisioned continental breakfast area. Park close to your room. Many restaurants very close. Reasonable value for the area. Close to Nixon library.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for sharing such a great experience!  It is always great to hear that one of our guests has enjoyed their stay and I am sure fellow trip advisors will find your review helpful as well.  There are a variety of restaurants in the area so hopefully you can try some new ones the next time you are in the area! Thank you again!

Summary: I recently spent two nights here. The rooms are clean and partly updated. They are all outside entrance, which didn't make me feel very secure. The pool/spa was nice. Free breakfast was what you'd expect.   The staff was friendly.   The freeway noise is my biggest complaint. If you are looking for a quite place to unwind, this isn't it.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your recent stay with us and providing us with feedback of your stay.  I am pleased that you found our staff friendly and did like our fully renovated rooms. We are an outside entrance hotel but are lucky enough to be located in a safe area.  We do so hope that you stay with us again and will do our best to have you in a pool side room.  Thank you again!

Summary: The Fairfield brand is Marriott's more basic property. Not quite a Courtyard but better than a traditional motel. The rooms are good sized and are smartly decorated in a modern theme. The bathroom has granite counter tops and was larger than most properties in this price range. The room has a microwave and small refrigerator. The room rate includes a hot breakfast as well. This location is a little hard to find as it is tucked away behind a shopping center and the SR91. There is no signage to help direct you. Even the Hertz "NeverLost" navigation system in my rental car had a tough time locating the property. If you are considering this location for a Disneyland visit, keep in mind that it can 30 or more minutes to the park from this location. Overall, good value.
Manager Response: Thank you for your recent stay with us.  It is pleasing to hear that you liked our newly renovated bathrooms as well as our revamped breakfast.  Disneyland normally takes just 15 minutes to get to but unfortunately there can be traffic which can make the trip seem longer.  We do hope to see you again soon!

Summary Heading: Newly refurbished room, good breakfast, great staff.
Summary: My wife, child, and I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights recently and we really enjoyed our stay.  I was pleasantly surprised at the great location as it was close to a freeway entrance, and had several eating establishments within walking distance.  The staff was very helpful with a few requests that we had during our stay, and the service was prompt.   The breakfast that was included in the stay was also very nice.   I would not hesitate to stay here again.
Manager Response: We certainly hope that you do stay with us again soon.  Thank you for not only staying with us but also sharing your experience.  We are pleased that you enjoyed the new rooms as well as our new breakfast.  Thank you again!

Summary: This hotel had a very friendly and attentive staff. The beds are extremely comfortable. I understand all rooms just went through renovation and you can tell because everything looks clean and modern. The location is nice because you have a Starbucks, Massage Envy, LA Fitness and Corner Bakery in the same parking lot. A nice dinner at Canyon Restaurant (in the same parking lot) topped off the weekend.  Great inexpensive getaway. I took my mom.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your recent stay!  I am glad that you and your mom enjoyed your special weekend and had a great experience.  The proximity to Starbucks, Massage Envy and Canyon Restaurant is definitely convenient.  Thank you for sharing your experience and we hope to see you again soon!

Summary Heading: Wanted to like this but not so much
Summary: I expected a lot more from a Marriott hotel especially as it was newly renovated with new beds. To it's credit the hotel staff were friendly, my room and the grounds were clean, the room was a nice size, plenty of hot water, great TV, a little frig, plenty of towels and lots of plugs, a great work desk and lamps which I loved.  I was only there for one night as I had a conference in the area however my conference discount was the same as the current regular price so am not sure I saved anything.  The hotel looks standard, it's right on the fwy so plenty of fwy noise but I was prepared to be happy. Another conference attendee had her room on the outside corridor and was distressed with all the noise. My room was closer to the pool yet even before I got to bed problems started,
Manager Response: Thank you so much for taking the time to let us know about your experience.  I am sorry that you were not able to enjoy a pleasant stay with us as that is always our goal.  We take these instances very serious and we are looking into ways to avoid these problems.  We are in the process of getting some new air conditioning and heater units for a more comfortable room experience.  I would like to discuss your stay with us in more detail so that I am better able to trouble shoot.  Please feel free to give me a call. I am glad to hear that you enjoyed our staff and hopefully we have an opportunity to wow you on your next stay.   Thank you,  Nicole Reid

Summary: We attended a wedding in the area.  The interior of the rooms were nicely upgraded from what we would have expected.  Check in was easy and a nice lobby.  Very clean and is next to a nice set of retail shops including Jamba Juice, Starbucks, and Corner Bakery  Also, close enough to freeway to get to other destinations.
Manager Response: It is so nice to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us and were able to enjoy the various restaurants located in the shopping center next to us.  Thank you so much for sharing your experience and we hope to see you the next time you are in the area.

Summary Heading: Probably should tell you about this place
Summary: I probably should reveal how nice this place is because it may be harder for us to get a reservation next time if too many people find out.  We have had to be down in this are three time since January, and stayed here each time.  Whenever we have to be in the area for family matters or vacation in recent years, we always try to stay here if we can.  The rooms have just been remodeled and they did a very nice job.  The staff has always been very friendly and willing to help out where they can and when you come  in the evening they always have fresh cookies out for you.  Even thought it is close to the freeway the rooms are very quiet and we have never had any problems.  They offer a nice free breakfast here and the lady who takes care of the food area is exceptional and goes out
Manager Response: Thank you so much for continuing to stay with us.  It is great to hear that you have enjoyed renovation as well as the launch of our hot breakfast.  Such a great tip with the raisins!  Thank you for taking the time to share your experience at our hotel with Trip Advisor and the Fairfield Inn Anaheim Hills and we look forward to you staying with us again!

Summary: What a nice relief to find a hotel that meets all your needs. nice looking remolded rooms, comfortable beds, nice hot tub for after the long day at disneyland, and the free breakfast make this a must stay for any needs.  don't let the distance to Disneyland scare you away quick jump on the freeway is only about 10 to 15min away.
Manager Response: It is always wonderful to see that we were successful in meeting all of a guests needs!  Thank you so much for your recent stay and for taking the time to share your experience with fellow TripAdvisors.  We hope to impress you again on your next trip to Disneyland!

Summary: It was spring break so most hotels near Disney were full or very expensive so we found the Fairfield still reasonable. It was about a 15 minute drive to Disney and we didn't hit traffic. Breakfast was plentiful with make your own waffles,scrambled eggs, and more.Staff were friendly when needed. Only drawback is the hotel faces a freeway and has road noise. There is a pool and hot tub and workout room.  There is a mall next to the hotel with plenty of restaurants and other shops.
Manager Response: Thank you for your recent stay with us.  It is always great to see that a guest enjoyed their stay and were able to enjoy their Disneyland trip.  Thank you so much for your feedback and the next time you are in the area we will try our best to get you away from the freeway side.  Thank you again and we hope to see you soon!

Summary: Very comfy beds and clean sheets! Rooms are new, but very small!  Only problem with the sheets is that i kept finding hairs on them frm others. Wide breakfast options with friendly staff! Overall enjoyable stay with the kiddos! I would definitely return on my next vacation!!!
Manager Response: I am so pleased to see that you enjoyed spending your vacation with us. I enjoy reading your feedback and see you not only enjoyed our clean newly renovated rooms but also our friendly staff and newly revamped breakfast.  I do hope the next time you are in the Anaheim area you will stay with us and I will definitely pass along the feedback on the sheets.  Thank you for taking the time to share your thoughts.

Summary Heading: Renewed, refreshed, and really nice for the price!
Summary: My husband was traveling on business and stays here often. I have traveled with him before but before the renovations. The one bedroom room was completely renewed with new bed, furniture, bath, shower, new granite counters in the bath, and looks great! I was pleasantly surprised to sleep the best I've slept in months. I woke every morning to their continental breakfast (very busy) serving oatmeal, fruits, pastries, waffles, cereal, eggs, fresh juice and coffee etc...  There is a Starbucks that I visited quite often in walking distance to enjoy the beautiful sunshine and coffee nearby along with other shops. This is definitely a secret of a place here in Anaheim for the price, but on this rare occasion I will share the secret.
Manager Response: It is always a joy to see that one of our guests had such an enjoyable stay.  We thank you for staying with us and also sharing your experience.  The next time you stay with us we will also have sausage patties for our new hot breakfast buffet.  Thank you for sharing this particular secret and we look forward to seeing you again soon!

Summary Heading: Great for no frills and clean
Summary: If you are looking for a really clean, inexpensive and convenient stop for a night or two this place is perfect! Great friendly staff, breakfast and wifi included and steps away from a strip mall with a starbucks, etc… A great choice!
Manager Response: Thank you for your stay and your review.  We here at the Fairfield Inn Anaheim Hills are pleased to see that you enjoyed your stay and met your needs in a hotel.  Hopefully the next time you are in the area for business you will stay with us again!

Summary: We are remodeling our House nearby, so stayed here for 5 days Last week. Everything about the Farifield is Excellent. They just remodeled the Entire Property so it is a brand New Looking Hotel.  Easy Parking right outside the room. Easy check in. We asked for Two rooms side by side and they accomodated us. The Gym is great, the pool nice , everything is Spotless.  The Rooms are very well appointed and Immaculate.  They are perfect for a family or Business Traveler, with a Big Closet, Microwave, Refrigerator. A big Desk for Work. Free Wifi. Plenty of plugs for Laptops or Iphones to charge. HDTV with HBO. A Free Buffet Breakfast everyday.  The Bathroom has a Jacuzzi Tub and a nice Shower with Good  water Pressure.  The Beds are VERY Comfortable. Slept Great.  The rooms are
Manager Response: Thank you for your recent stay with us and we are so pleased to see that we were able fulfill your needs of having adjacent rooms as well as a comfortable and functional room.  We are very happy that you enjoyed our newly renovated hotel and we hope that you stay with us again the next time that you are in the Anaheim area. Thank you again!

Summary: This property has been completely renovated and the rooms are functional, and well appointed.  I stayed at this location for  two nights, which I thoroughly enjoyed.  The rooms are new, and very modern, as well as having very comfortable beds.  The ladies at the front desk, were extremely cheerful, and helpful.  When I visit southern CA, I will make it a point to stay at this location.
Manager Response: On behalf of the Fairfield Inn Anaheim Hills, thank you so much for taking the time to stay with us and to write your review.  Feedback is appreciated and we are thrilled that you enjoyed not only our renovated rooms but our service as well.  We look forward to your next stay with us!

Summary Heading: Staff and breakfast make this a great value
Summary: We stayed at this hotel for our recent trip to Disneyland.  While I would not recommend it proximity to the park - it's about 45 minutes away in traffic - it a great little hotel. There are a handful of restaurants a grocery store and Starbucks all very near by. It is close to the freeway... So a big noisy - but the breakfast and staff are fantastic.  There are many items to choose from - like make your own Belgium waffles and breakfast sandwiches. Great value.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write this reveiw as we appreciate guest feedback.  I am glad that you were able to experience our breakfast as well as our friendly staff that helped make this a pleasant trip for you.  I am sorry that due to traffic it took so long to get to the park as normally it takes about 15 minutes.  It is my hope that you will come stay with us again the next time you and your family are in town as we have more changes coming such as our breakfast which will still include the waffles but we will be adding sausage and scrambled eggs.  Thank you again!

Summary Heading: Mixed review - some good, some not
Summary: When I checked in I was a little nervous as the outside has the appearance of an old motel.  Walkway in front of each of the rooms.    The room itself was much nicer than I expected.  The only complain here is the room heater/air conditioner was loud and hard to keep a constant temperature.  Bed was very comfortable.  I could hear outside noise/people walking by but the loud fan drowned most of it out.  Very convenient to the 91 freeway and I made it to Anaheim much faster than I expected.    The computers in the lobby were not working so I couldnt print out my boarding pass.    Breakfast was standard Fairfield inn and very adequate.  Excellent running trail that is close to the hotel.  For that reason alone I would probably stay there again.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your recent stay and also providing your feedback as well.  This is always helpful so that we can make changes to improve our guests stay.  I am pleased to see that you were pleasantly surprised by the room as we have just completed our renovation.  I am sorry that the business center was not yet up so that you were able to print your boarding passes.  We would have been more than happy to get those printed for you.  Since your stay the business center is now up in our newly renovated lobby for guests convenience.  Hopefully you will get the chance to use it and the running trail again on your next stay.  Thank you so much for your feedback and we hope to see you again soon!

Summary: We selected this place sight unseen via the Marriott website. We were on vacation in Las Vegas and wanted a side trip to the LA area. Although the lobby was under construction, the room offered was great! It was small but very clean. The rooms must have been re-done recently. My only complaint, one that I wrote up in the Hotel's survey was that the sheets did not appear to have been changed since the last guest. Although my wife and I would normally not stand for this, we were way to exhausted to call the front desk at a late hour and deal with waiting for housekeeping personal to change the sheets. We dusted everything off and slept there for the one night. I recommend the hotel but, make sure you check your sheets.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for taking the time to not only stay with us but to write this review.  We appreciate your comments and I have passed along the information in regards to the sheets.   Here at the Fairfield Inn Anaheim Hills we strive to give each guests a fresh clean room.  We are in the final stages of the renovation so our rooms have been completely redone and I am so pleased that you were able to notice our hard work and incredible change.  We will be done with the lobby soon and I would love for you to come back the next time you are in town so you can not only experience a fresh hotel but also a fresh room and a fresh experience.  Thank you again!

Summary: This hotel really sucks. You won't be disappointed with your room-- it's clean and standard. But all the rooms wrap around the parking lot and the noise from cars, people, and people's music is really over bearing (and I live in Brooklyn) so don't expect to get any rest. The hotel staff is cheerful, but not helpful. They basically dismiss your issues without apology or offering alternatives. Would definitely recommend a different hotel. Don't waste your time or sleep here.
Manager Response: I am so sorry to hear that you did not enjoy your stay with us.  We strive offer a relaxing stay as well as friendly yet helpful service.  I would like to hear more about the issues that you have experienced so that I can look further into them.  My email is nicole.reid@marriott.com.  I do appreciate you taking the time to write this review and do hope that in the future you return to see what this newly renovated hotel has to offer.   Thank you.

Summary Heading: Economy motel,small rooms & hard to find
Summary: Stayed in this location for few days,had a hard time to find the entrance to the hotel which was visible from the freeway but very confusing to find it through the back. The rooms are very small , carpets old, smell of the deodorizer overbearing but complimentary continental breakfast  makes it very economical for family with children .the comfortable bed by Marriott was the best and makes the stay something to remember. Overall rating of this hotel is ok and average.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for taking the time to write your review.  I apologize that you had challenges finding our location.  It sounds as if you stayed in one of our old rooms.  We are actually in the final stages of our renovation and the rooms are completely different.  I do hope that you will stay at our hotel again when you return to the area.  In April we will be changing our breakfast so that it includes scrambled eggs and sausage.  Thank you again for taking the time to review us so that we know what we can improve.

Summary Heading: The Good, the Bad and the Ugly
Summary: I'll start with the ugly. They are doing a remodel so there are many full dumpsters in the parking lot making it very unsightly. The Bad:  The heater stopped working in the middle of the night and the new trend in Marriott hotels is to just supply one thin blanket. There were no extra blankets in the room. The freeway noise was very loud all night long. It was hard to sleep. The workman had the elevator tied up, so I had to carry my luggage up four flights of stairs. The Good: The room was renovated and the breakfast was good. And the best part, they refunded me the cost of the room because there was no heat.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write a review of your recent stay.  I apologize that you were not able to enjoy a good nights sleep due to the noise from the freeway and the heat that went out.  We have learned from this and have taken steps to ensure guests a warm nights sleep.  We are looking forward to the end of our renovation soon and do hope that you will return when it is complete.  We enjoy having guests such as yourself stay with us and I was pleased to see that we were able to take of the night for you.  If you have any questions please do not hesitate to contact us.  I am pleased to hear that you enjoyed our breakfast and am thrilled to inform you that we will be making more improvements this year by adding scrambled eggs and sausage.  Thank you again!

Summary Heading: Find the Fairfield Inn-it's worth it.
Summary: It's still under renovation, exercise room and hot tub closed.  There is a good walking trail on the nearby Santa Ana Canyon Road, though.  Good breakfast, friendly staff, centrally located near shopping centers, churches etc. Good noise proofing (freeway sounds are not obtrusive) so it seems quiet.
Manager Response: I am so pleased to hear that you enjoyed your stay although we are under renovation.  Hopefully you were able to stay in one of our newly renovated rooms.  I am glad that you enjoyed our breakfast which will be changing again in April to include sausage and eggs and that you experienced friendly service.  I do hope that you return once the renovation is complete.  Thank you so much for taking the time to write this review.

Summary Heading: Most friendly staff of any Hotel l've stayed at (& that's lots of hotels)
Summary: Just stayed at the Fairfield Inn for 5 days.  The hotel is undergoing renovation and will be,lovely when that is complete.  Even now the rooms are comfortable and clean.  It's inexpensive, close to a freeway (great for access) and that said, if you get a room facing away from the freeway, very quiet.  It is very good value for $.  BUT the biggest thing going for this hotel is the friendly & helpful staff.  The GM is awesome - nicest, most helpful lady ever.  Nothing was a problem.  And the other staff are just as helpful too.  For the price, l thought it was great value.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review Glynis.  On behalf of my GM and the rest of the staff here at the Fairfield Inn Anaheim Hills I would like to say that we definitely enjoyed having you stay with us and hope that the next time you are in the area you will stay with us again in one of our newly renovated rooms.  Thank you for staying with us!

Summary: If you are going to be in the Anaheim Hills area and need a place to stay, I highly recommend the Fairfield Inn by Marriott. I had a problem locating the property online with Mapquest only because I kept putting in Anaheim Hills - Mapquest didn't recognize the Hills part.   First of all the Fairfield Inn is close to the 5, 55, and 91 freeways which is handy whether you are on business or vacationing in the area. Nestled just off Imperial Hwy and Santa Ana Canyon Road the property makes it easy to get to those freeways quickly.  The room was nicely decorated and clean. The room had a king size bed which was very comfortable. The sheets were crisp and spotless and the pillows were soft. The bathroom seemed larger than most and was well lit. Only two complaints about the bathroom -
Manager Response: I am so pleased to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us!  Thank you so much for your review.  Yes we are under renovations and it is our goal to keep our guests as comfortable and away from noise as possibel during this time so I am glad this did not impact you.  I hope that you will return once our renovation is complete as I think you will really like the rooms with their modern and colorful decor yet still being comfortable.  The only thing we will not be changing during the renovation is our helpful and friendly staff.  Thank you for staying with us and we hope to see you soon!

Summary: My boyfriend and I stayed here 2 weekends ago during our bi-annual trip to SoCal. At first, we got lost and went into the opposite side where houses were located because the iPhone 5's GPS was tweaking out. It may be hard to find, but it's behind houses and across a car dealership? We arrived late Thursday night around 9pm and the lady at the front desk was nice and checked us in.  It reminds me of a motel, but a very nice motel! Our room was nice. It was very clean, but very small. The bed was comfortable, had many pillows, and the sheets were clean. The bathroom had a sliding door. It had everything we needed. My boyfriend and I aren't very needy with these things because we always bring our own stuff. Our room also had a microwave. The channels on the TV were cool too, it was
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your review and I am so pleased that you enjoyed your stay!  We are in the middle of our renovation and this has definitely had an impact on parking however we do have parking available for guests in the shopping center right next door!  Hopefully the next time you make your bi-annual trip to the area you will stay with us again in one of our newly renovated rooms.  I have a feeling you will like them even more than our current rooms.  Thank you!

Summary: We visited California in April 2012 and friends suggested that we stay in the Anaheim area since it is convenient to many locations.  We thought that the location was perfect for us.  Just off the freeway and only about 20 minutes from the major attractions, like Disneyland.  We felt like we were far enough away from the congestion of the "tourist" areas but close enough that the drive didn't seem to long.  We were 90 minutes from San Diego so that made for a nice day trip.  We were also a resonable drive to Laguna Beach which allowed us to drive back up through Newport Beach and Huntington Beach.  Going north to LA and Hollywood was a little rough with the traffic.  It took us about 90 minutes to get from Anaheim Hiils to LA on a weekday morning after what we thought would be
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your review.  It is so nice to hear that our friendly and knowledgeable staff were able to assist you and that you liked our proximitity to the various attractions that Southern California has to offer.  Hopefully the next time you make the trip out here you will stay with us again as we will be completely renovated with nice new look and feel with the same great customer service.  In addition, sometime in 2013 we will be launching our new breakfast which will include eggs and sausage as well!  Once again thank you for staying with us.

Summary: Musty room and the A/C unit was not on, cobwebs across the room and in the bathtub, filthy sheets, dead insects & dusts on curtains and on top of A/C unit.  We turn on the A/C unit & dusts and dead bugs were flying across the room.  Called the front desk and said will send someone to check the room, no one came, second call and a guy (not  housekeeper) came and said there is no housekeeper present at the time and said he will clean if we want him to. We took our stuff, went down to front desk, clerk ask if we want to talk to the manager.  Manager came out. We asked to be transferred to another room and said there is no other room available. Manager was not very nice.  We were not able to use the room right away when we needed to as we have to wait until they finish cleaning.
Manager Response: I am so sorry to hear that your recent stay with us was not a pleasant one.  We do take pride in making sure every guest is able to relax in a nice clean room.  I have taken note of the issues addressed above and will be looking into them.  Thank you for your review.  It is my hope that you might stay with us again especially after our renovation so that you may experience our new rooms and our great customer service.

Summary Heading: Not so close from Disneyland but a good choice!!!
Summary: In my opinion the hotel is a good option.   My wife and I decided to stay there because they offer a good price (below than Fairfield Anaheim close to Disney) with a quality that we usually expected for a hotel of the Fairfield Inn chain.  It is really not so close to Disneyland (it takes around 20 minutes by car), but it was not a problem for us.  The hotel has good facilities. It is according to what you are paying. Free parking, pool, vending machines, etc. The room is comfortable and we didn't have any problem during our stay.  The breakfast is also good (sandwiches, waffles, cereals, fruits, muffins, etc).  I definetively reccomend this hotel if you want to enjoy Disneyland Resort or stay there for any other reason.
Manager Response: Thank you for for such kind remarks about the hotel Lucas!  We are pleased to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us.  Yes Disneyland is about 15 to 20 minutes away but one good thing is we are in a much quieter location.  I see that you noticed everything that we have to offer.  We will be making improvements beginning later this year and will also be adding a market.  I see that you also enjoyed our breakfast which I am pleased to see.  The next time you are in the area please stay with us again!  Thank you!

Summary Heading: Clean Hotel But Didn't Seem Like a Marriott
Summary: Stayed her two night.  It really didn't seem like a Marriott.  It seemed like a Motel.  I did see in their Lobby an upgrade is scheduled soon (which is good and needed).  Room was OK - a little dark.  I used the exercise room near the poop - equipment was create but I tried to look for their air conditioning and could not find it.  It was hot in there and I had to leave.  Staff was pleasant.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for staying with us and giving us your opinion!  I am glad that you noticed that we will be undergoing a renovation later this year.  This will definitely change the look and feel of the hotel and give it some brightness.  I am sorry that there was trouble finding the air conditioner in our gym.  Please next time let us know so that one of our friendly staff can assist in locating it.  Speaking of friendly staff I am pleased to hear that you noticed how pleasant all of our staff is.  I hope that once our renovation is complete you will return to the hotel to stay when you are in the area.   Thank you again!

Summary: For the price this is offers a clean and comfortable stay. Rooms were ample enough and well equipped. Staff were efficient, helpful and courteous. The area is fairly quiet, next to a shopping centre. No complaints.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Place is ok but dont select a room facing the highway!
Summary: My wife and I stayed here on a trip to California.  Overall the staff was really friendly.  It is up to date and the beds are pretty comfortable.  Has a samsung TV, fridge, and a microwave. It was clean and had no issues with the cosmetics of the place.  Overall it had everything we needed but the room the gave us faced the highway and a resturant.  It was pretty loud at night and they are doing construction on the ramp.  It wasnt that bad but just be aware that if you are a light sleeper it will probably bother you.  It was just an average place to stay.  Nothing really stood out as great.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Its a shame they associate this place with the Marriott brand. I am a Platinum Mariott member and have to say this is the worse Mariott property I have ever stayed in. Room had a very offensive smell, filthy carpets and doors, staff is below average and I needed to speak to more than one person to get my answers/requests fulfilled. Manager on duty 'screened' her calls and never spoke to me and let her staff 'deal with it'. This was enough reason for me to cut my stay in this property short and checked into a competitor's property which was a million times better.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Excellent and friendly staff. Older hotel but clean and comfortable beds. Noisy location and older style motel where doors open to exterior corridor so you can hear all that's going on outside.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: THUMBS DOWN!!!!!!!    Inconvenient Location, Poor Housekeeping
Summary: Booked this hotel by mistake. I thought it was closer to Disneyland but decided to give it a chance because the rates were good. Shoulda spent that extra dollar to stay closer..... You have to take 2 freeways then drive several miles on Ball Road to get to Disneyland. The hotel itself looks nice, very nice pool and the rooms are a decent size. Housekeeping wasn't up to the task I think. Beds were made daily yet, our housekeeper left garbage in our room. Dirty cups left by the coffee pot, dirty towels and I asked for extra shampoo and conditioner only got it one day and we stayed for 3. After the first night our room key stopped working.....there was a hotel staff member walking by who let us in both times but it was extemely frustrating.  Overall would spend a few bucks more to
Manager Response: none

Summary: My family and I stayed here last week for 1 night before going to Disneyland the next day. The reasonable rate was very enticing and we decided to go for it as opposed to staying in the Disneyland area where prices for even the worst hotel rooms are quite expensive. Not to mention you will pay for parking as well, usually 10$ and higher for your stay. Hotel is right off freeway and the area showed many places to eat/drink along with a large grocery store across the street. Room was not huge by any means but fine for 3 adults and 2 kids. Was a bit cramped when pull out couch was out but that is to be expected. Room has baby coffeemaker(didn't use though), larger than your usual mini fridge, and microwave in the room as well. The only thing that was concerning was the fact that
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your kind review!  Here at the Fairfield Inn Anaheim Hills we appreciate feedback so that we can improve.  I am so pleased that you enjoyed our newly updated breakfast offerings.  We are making changes here at the hotel and we look forward to your next stay when returning to the Disneyland area.

Summary: My friend and I stayed here for a recent Disneyland weekend.  It was very convenient with Disneyland 15-20 minutes away.  For a hotel at this price point, the room was nice.  It did seem a bit crammed with furniture but overall very good.  I liked the fact that our room had a microwave and fridge.  One draw back is that the heating system was a window unit, which meant there was no auto shutoff once the desired temperature was reached.  The staff were very nice and the free breakfast was great.  They have a nice breakfast selection and very good coffee.  It's an older property but it is in good repair and very clean.  Overall - we had a nice stay and we would stay here again.
Manager Response: I am pleased that you have enjoyed your stay with us here at the Fairfield Inn Anaheim Hills.  I appreciate your comments and you staying with us.  Later this year we will be undergoing a renovation which should alleviate that crammed feeling for increased comfort.  We look forward to your next stay with us!

Summary: Nice, clean, well kept property.  The king bed plus sofa room was very comfortable, 4 fluffy pillows and comfy bed, plus the earlier review about the coffee at breakfast is true.  It's amazingly great!  Close to the 91 so a bit of freeway noise coming into the room depending on room location but no major issue.  Overall, I'll be staying there again on future visits.
Manager Response: none

Summary: The hotel is easy to get to with access of the 91 (via the 90). 20 minutes to Disneyland each time (weekend and mid-week). Can't beat the free parking or breakfast (surprisingly good coffee). The hotel has the doors on the outside like a motel, not inside doors via a hallway. The shower curtain didn't really fit the curved bar so water got out. However, the shower head was awesome and really nice. Fridge in the room helped and the small flat screen was great for watching TV at night.
Manager Response: none

Summary: My recent stay at this Fairfield Inn was very enjoyable and the price was right.  The Shower wall had cracks where the shower curtain was and another crack by the water nozzle.  There was a crack by the soap dish area that had been repair with RTV.  Otherwise the room was very spacious and clean.  I would stay there again.
Manager Response: none

Summary: For this level of hotel this is excellent quality with attention to detail and very well run. Parking is very convenient and free, No need to go throught the lobby to get to your room.
Manager Response: none

Summary: My Mom & I were there for my cousins wedding & after a poor experience at another property up the road - we were walk-ins and very welcomed by the cheerful, helpful front desk team.  A value oriented rate and a very nice (yes, small) room with all amenities necessary.  We liked the brightness of the room too and the included breakfast was ample and perfect for us to begin our day.  And I really appreciated the newspaper. Close to lots of restaurants within walking.  Easy access, plenty of parking. And I dug the picture JR Marriott in the lobby - apparently the hotel sits on former ranch property of his.   Now I know to look for a Fairfield by Marriott for quality & value.
Manager Response: none

Summary: My boyfriend and I needed a place to stay while I visited my relatives in Anaheim Hills, Anaheim, CA. This was the perfect place - while the room was small, it was always very clean; it had a lot of amenities like a hair dryer, free internet and air-conditioning; the king-size bed was large and comfortable with wonderfully soft pillows; it had nice parking spots; it was near the freeways, and yet it was fairly quiet; it was close to a lot of restaurants and convenience stores; and the staff were very attentive to our needs. I feel bad that we weren't able to avail the free breakfast that came with the accommodation, but I was jet-lagged so I never woke up early enough to get it (my boyfriend was fussing over me since I am a very light sleeper and had flown in straight out of
Manager Response: none

Summary: The hotel is located in a good area.  There are plenty of places around to eat.  Easy freeway access.  The rooms facing the freeway are a little noisy.  Staff was friendly. The room and bathroom were clean.  The beds were comfortable. However, the hotel claims they are queen size.  If they are, they are a SMALL queen size bed.  My husband and I have a queen at home and sleep fine, without hitting each other when we turn.  On the hotel bed, we were constantly in each others space.  Small bed!!  The pillows were horrible.  When you lay your head down, it sunk!  It took 2 or 3 pillows to be somewhat comfortable. The rooms are small.  We booked the "suite".  It was supposed to have 2 queen beds with a pull out couch.  Well, I already went over the beds.  As for the couch, it was a
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Nice place to stay for Anaheim activities
Summary: I stayed here with a friend to go to a few Angels games and it was good.  It's what you would expect from a Fairfield Inn and the staff was nice.  It is in a fairly quiet area, so the sleep quality was decent.  It's only about 15-20 minutes from Disneyland, Angels Stadium, and the Honda Center.  It's right off I-91, so it's easy to get around.  It's a great place to stay for Anaheim events if you want to avoid the crowds near the Disneyland area.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed here because late last year we had stayed right on the "strip" for Disneyland at the Fairfield Inn across the street from the park and it was really gross (as most hotels on that strip seem to be).  Plus, this was a last minute trip and rates were very high for those closer hotels.  We figured we'd get a better value and better quality staying some distance away from the park.  WRONG!  I am appalled that Marriott allows this hotel to run under its brand.  The room was so old and worn and very seedy feeling.  I've never stayed in a Motel 6 but that is what my husband compared it to.  There were unknown stains on the bedskirt and in the carpet, etc.    Our bathroom was anything but clean...there were pubic looking hairs surrounding the entire floor around the toilet.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Book a king, got a queen. No kleanex in room. No extra pillows provided. Rooms on third floor by room 300 shouldn't be allow for occupancy-very noise fan. Heater is a manual window that doesn't cutoff. This part of the motel/hotel looks, feels like a motel 6! No lies. If your lucky, you will never find this place. My bad luck.
Manager Response: none

Summary: This hotel is very heavily used and it kind of shows.  Couple of cracks/dings on the furniture.  TV in the room did not work very well.  Breakfast was pretty basic; first Fairfield I have stayed at that did NOT have a waffle maker.  Rooms facing the freeway are pretty noisy and there are a lot of kids running up and down.  Not the quietest place.  Staff was great; very friendly and helpful.  Location is good for access to Orange County, but remember ths is NOT right at Disneyland!
Manager Response: none

Summary: I picked this hotel with a package from expedia. The room was EXTREMELY  inexpensive.   I did much research about hotels near Disney.  As a budget minded traveler with young kids, hotels within walking distance that I could afford, seemed a bit seedy.  So a few miles away (only about 15 minutes by car), Fairfield inn seemed a good choice.  It was in a nice neighborhood with a Mercedes dealer right next door.  Because previous reviewers complained of noise because of the nearby highway, I requested a pool view room which was kindly given to us.  Check-in was easy.  Honestly, our family only used this room to sleep in.  It was clean, the beds were comfortable, and the bathroom was quite nice sized.  Either we got really lucky with good neighbors or the room was VERY quiet at
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: $10 more & two miles up the road
Summary: and you can stay at a nicer place with better service and a real breakfast.  I booked this for the weekend for a family event. I specifically asked for two beds or a bed and a sofa sleeper since we were traveling with two kids. I arrived 30 minutes after check in and was informed only one room was available. I hauled the bags to the room to find it only had one bed. The desk clerk said it was my fault as I must have asked for only one bed. I checked out and drove one exit east and stayed in a studio suite with a wonderful king bed and nice sofa sleeper at the Ayers suites for $109. Free wifi, a real breakfast, and real customer service.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I booked my room through Priceline for extended family that were visiting for the week. Got a very good deal at a little under $40 per night for 5 nights.  I requested two beds, but the room was quite small with little room to walk around.  Although there was a mini-fridge, microwave, desk, and lounge chair, it was all crammed into the room.  While there was free continental breakfast each morning, free parking, and was relatively clean, it was way too close to the 91 freeway.  If you can, request a room not facing the highway (rather facing the pool), you won't have to listen to the sound of cars when you are in your room.  So, if you're looking for a cheap hotel stay for a few nights in the Anaheim Hills / Yorba Linda area, this is a decent place. I recommend using Priceline
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: An excellent choice in the Anaheim area...
Summary: I can't say one bad thing about this hotel. We were on our first trip to Disneyland and this hotel was just what we needed. The staff kept our room impeccably clean for the 11 nights we spent there. The staff was courteous and friendly. The free breakfast was nothing special but certainly met our needs. If you're planning on a vacation in the area I highly recommend the Fairfield Inn of Anaheim Hills. You're not right next door to Disney but there is no daily parking fee that the closer hotels have and it's only a 15 minute drive. If you can, try to request a room overlooking the pool.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Very professional staff, very clean considering it is a 2-start hotel. We enjoyed the free breakfast and it exceeded our expectations and there was a waitress looking after the guests and hot food was promptly brought in. It has a nice pool which we didn't use. The area is very quiet and close to a plaza with different restaurants. I will stay there again.   Cons: The bathroom looked outdated and I didn't like the slide door but we only used it for minutes every day. Towels weren't fluffy but that's a 2-star quality.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Nothing Fancy, but Clean and Courteous
